intro: Sasamorpha tobaeana, commonly known as the Toba sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Sasamorpha tobaeana is adapted to extreme environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes in its native habitat.
